p: With the emergence of new viral strains and increasing resistance to standard antiviral therapy, and the fact that most of the available antiviral therapies are non-specific for particular viruses [ 8], the key focus of medical research is therefore centered on the development of specific and cost-effective antiviral regimens [ 9, 10], which include alternative treatment from herbal sources. At present, several antiviral vaccinations are available including human papilloma virus [ 11], hepatitis A and B virus [ 12], varicella, measles, mumps, rubella [ 13], and rabies [ 14]. However, there are still no vaccines for a few other viral infections.
